kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
Make sure you are using the right C# types because Xperience currently has 2 sets of Form Components that are not interoperable.
1. [Form Components from the Form Builder](https://docs.kentico.com/x/YIbWCQ) (or Legacy Page Builder)
1. namespace - `Kentico.Forms.Web.Mvc` 2. [UI Form Components based on React](https://docs.kentico.com/x/5ASiCQ) and Xperience administration UI technology
1. namespace - `Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.Forms`
These are in different namespaces and it's unfortunately very easy to confuse them.
If you want to see a functioning example of custom UI Form Components (and custom data types) check out the [Kentico Community Portal source code](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.2.0.0/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Features/Content/LinkDataTypeRegistrar.cs) or read the blog post [Embedded structured content and the power of custom data types](https://community.kentico.com/blog/embedded-structured-content-and-the-power-of-custom-data-types).
You can also see an example of a [UI Form Component registered for an existing data type](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.2.0.0/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Components/MarkdownFormComponent.cs) (`text/string`).
